item.title: Meta’s VR Branch Lost $19 Billion Last Year
item.content:encoded:
Meta’s recent earnings report revealed that its virtual reality division lost over $19 billion in the last year.

Earlier this month, Meta announced it would scale back its gaming presence, laying off 10% of Reality Labs staff. This led to the supposed cancellation of the Harry Potter VR game, as well as the Batman Arkham Shadow sequel. Now, a new report reveals just how much they have lost in this business.

According to a TechCrunch report, Meta’s latest earnings reveal that its virtual reality division incurred a $19.1 billion loss in 2025, up from a $17.7 billion loss the previous year. Of this total, $6.2 billion was lost in the fourth quarter alone. Mark Zuckerberg also mentioned that the company will focus most of its investments on “glasses and wearables” for the Reality Labs division moving forward.

The CEO stated that there will be an increased focus on Horizon, Meta’s VR social ecosystem, trying to make it a “massive success on mobile.” The goal is to turn virtual reality into a profitable ecosystem. Zuckerberg also mentioned that losses are expected to remain similar this year; however, he believes that the losses in 2025 are likely to be the “peak” and will gradually decrease thereafter. Interested readers can find the complete statement below:

“For Reality Labs, we are directing most of our investment towards glasses and wearables going forward, while focusing on making Horizon a massive success on Mobile and making VR a profitable ecosystem over the coming years. I expect Reality Labs losses this year to be similar to last year, and this will likely be the peak, as we start to gradually reduce our losses going forward.”

item.title: WWE 2K26 Not Releasing On Last-Gen Consoles
item.content:encoded:
WWE 2K26 is finally moving to the modern era. According to the game’s ratings page on the ESRB website, WWE 2K26 will no longer release on last-gen consoles.

That means those only playing on PlayStation 4 and Xbox One are seemingly out of luck.

The ESRB Page Gives A Bit Away

A visit to the game’s page on the website mentions a release on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, Nintendo Switch 2, and PC. That lines up with what had been previously reported on the status of the game.

Insider Gaming has also reported in the past that The Island mode was set to come to PC this year. With it only being on current-gen systems and PC, it now makes sense as to why.

2K Sports has yet to officially confirm this, so it could be a case of just missing the systems. That said, with it so close to the game’s March 13 release, it’s highly likely that what’s on the ESRB website is accurate.

WWE 2K26 is expected to have a number of improved features and even some new and returning match types this year. One of the game’s main modes, Showcase Mode, will also feature current World Heavyweight Champion CM Punk. Other features include the Draft in Universe mode, a revamped reversal system, intergender matches in MyFACTION, and more.

What do you think of WWE 2K26 leaving last-gen systems in the past? Leave your thoughts down in the comments below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

item.title: Metal Gear Solid’s ‘Solid Snake’ is Coming to Rainbow 6 Siege as an Operator
item.content:encoded:
New datamines have revealed that Metal Gear Solid’s ‘Solid Snake’ will soon be making his way to Ubisoft‘s Rainbow 6 Siege as an operator.

The news, posted by the reputable Rainbow 6 Siege dataminer ‘Shiny‘, will apparently be part of Year 11, Season 1, which is scheduled to take place in March.

Inisder Gaming has also been able to independently verify that the leaks are legitimate.

Solid Snake is the main protagonist from the Metal Gear Solid franchise by Konami, with the latest game to be released being Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater, a remake of the original 2004 title.

As of the time of writing, Ubisoft has yet to officially announce the collaberation, but with Y11S1 scheduled to take place in March, we should hear an announcement soon.

Are you looking forward to seeing Solid Snake as an operator in Rainbow 6 Siege? Let us know in our official Discord server.
